title: suBSTITUTE FOR QUIXOTE
content:
Hi ...  
Maybe someone can help me find the closest substitute for a font name : QUIXOTE  
you can see this font here : [www.textaxis.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20081203115845/http:/www.textaxis.com/ "www.textaxis.com")  
is is a font built for aa magazine named : suit  
and i like the caligraphy and freedom like in the big Q etc

thanks a lot....

Zeev

 [‹ Logo font / body text](http://web.archive.org/web/20081203115845/http:/www.typophile.com/node/39276 "Go to previous forum topic") [Replacing Garamond 3 with the other Garamond family ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081203115845/http:/www.typophile.com/node/39208 "Go to next forum topic")
author: MRSINGER

comments.content: Looked at your work. Oneline is really nice, reminds me of work by Gareth Hague / Alias Foundry, but perhaps yours is a bit better. As for (re)naming of Quixote. how about SuiteText,

I think the closest font I can find is [Corundum](http://web.archive.org/web/20081203115845/http:/www.vllg.com/JoshuaDarden/CorundumText/mudTyper+Weights/) but it doesn’t have the same Q that you like.
Zeev, I would contact Textaxis and see if they can license a copy to you.

Hi Chris, thanks for your good intentions.. but i have  
already contact them.  
It is not for purchase.  
That why I’m looking for a substitute...  
Zeev
